casebody.data:
George Southwick, Respondent v. Adolph Bernhard, Appellant. Decided January 11, 1892. Appeal by defendant from judgment entered upon the verdict of a jury in plaintiff’s favor, and from an order denying defendant’s motion for a new trial. Action to recover damages for wrongful discharge of plaintiff from defendant’s employ. E. A. Jacob, attorney, and David Leventritt of counsel, for appellant. Milnor & Willis, for respondent.

Before Freedman, P. J., McAdam and Gildersleeve, JJ.

Opinion by McAdam, J.; Freedman, P. J., and Gildersleeve, J., concurred.

Judgment and order affirmed, with costs.
